intro.title: Welcome ðŸ‘‹
intro.body:
This dashboard helps you plan your path to Financial Independence (FI).

Start by adding your current assets, income, and expenses. Then set your assumptions (returns, years, and contributions). The charts will show your projected net worth and when investment income could cover your expenses.

quick_stats.title: Quick stats
quick_stats.body: A snapshot of your current Net Worth, Annual Contribution, estimated Years to FI (4% rule), and Savings Rate. These update as you edit inputs.

tabs.title: Inputs vs Graphs
tabs.body: Use Inputs to enter your data. Switch to Graphs to visualize projections and insights.

assets.title: Assets
assets.body:
Add each asset with its current value and a target allocation %.

Use this to track how far you are from your ideal portfolio and what to buy next to rebalance.

assumptions.title: Assumptions & Contributions
assumptions.body: Set pessimistic/realistic/optimistic annual returns, the projection horizon (years), and your recurring contribution. These feed the projections and FI analysis.

incomes.title: Income streams
incomes.body: List your monthly income sources (e.g., salary, rental). This is used to compute your savings and can help set an appropriate contribution.

expenses.title: Expenses
expenses.body: List your monthly expenses by category. This determines your annual expenses, a key input for the FI targets and the red line in the FI chart.

income_savings.title: Income & savings
income_savings.body:

fi_progress.title: FI progress (4% rule)
